title: Update color scheme and currency to Ghana Cedis

requirements.text: Replace the current color scheme in frontend/index.css and frontend/src/index.css with the user-provided color codes throughout the application theme including backgrounds, borders, text colors, and accent colors
acceptanceCriteria: All OKLCH color variables in the CSS files are updated to match the provided color codes
The new colors are consistently applied across all pages (Dashboard, Products, Sales)
Light and dark mode variants use the new color palette
UI components (buttons, cards, tables, forms) reflect the updated color scheme

requirements.text: Change all currency displays from the current format to Ghana Cedis (GH₵) including product prices (wholesale and retail), sales transaction amounts, dashboard metrics (total inventory value, sales totals), and any other monetary values shown in the application

quotes: let the currency be in ghana cedis

acceptanceCriteria: All monetary values display the GH₵ symbol prefix
Backend stores prices and amounts as numeric values without currency symbols
Frontend formats all displayed prices and amounts with 'GH₵' prefix and two decimal places
Currency formatting is consistent across ProductForm, ProductTable, SaleForm, TransactionHistory, RecentTransactions, and MetricCard components
Dashboard metric cards show inventory value and sales totals in Ghana Cedis format

constraints: Do not modify authentication logic in frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts
Do not change the backend data schema for products and sales
Preserve the single-actor architecture in backend/main.mo
Do not edit files in frontend/src/components/ui directory
nonGoals: Adding multi-currency support or currency conversion features
Changing the application's core functionality beyond visual updates
Modifying the data structure to store currency type
